New Records: The Nuggets have a 9-5 record in home games and average 14.0 turnovers per game, while the Hawks have an 8-8 away record and a 9-9 record in games decided by 10 points or more.
Key Match Events: The Nuggets have gone 7-3 in their last 10 games, averaging 126.5 points, 45.9 rebounds, 33.4 assists, 8.9 steals, and 4.0 blocks per game while shooting 53.2% from the field. The Hawks have gone 6-4 in their last 10 games, averaging 120.7 points, 45.8 rebounds, 30.0 assists, 10.8 steals, and 5.3 blocks per game while shooting 47.3% from the field.
Pre-Game Insights: Denver is 6-4 when it has fewer turnovers than its opponents and averages 14.0 turnovers per game. The Hawks have a 9-9 record in games decided by 10 points or more.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Nuggets make 50.1% of their shots from the field, which is 3.0 percentage points higher than the Hawks have allowed to their opponents (47.1%). The Hawks average 117.8 points per game, 0.3 more than the 117.5 the Nuggets give up. Nikola Jokic is averaging 31 points, 12.9 rebounds, 9.5 assists, and 1.8 steals for the Nuggets. Trae Young is scoring 22.0 points per game and averaging 3.6 rebounds for the Hawks. The Nuggets have a 6-4 record when they have fewer turnovers than their opponents.
Others: Atlanta seeks to extend its four-game win streak with a victory over Denver. The Nuggets have key players like Aaron Gordon, DaRon Holmes II, and Vlatko Cancar out due to injuries. The Hawks have several players with injury concerns as well, including Bogdan Bogdanovic, Kobe Bufkin, Larry Nance Jr., Dyson Daniels, and Cody Zeller.
